channel.title: Hugo 101 on Maximilian Holzmüller
channel.description: Recent content in Hugo 101 on Maximilian Holzmüller

item.title: High School
item.description: Details Institution: Gymnasium bei St. Anna, Augsburg, Germany Duration: September 2008 - June 2016 (8 years) GPA: 2.5 (German high school scale) About my High School Education My high school’s education was focused on the humanities and offered a wide variety of classes. However, the focus was clearly on languages and social sciences but not limited to those. Most memorably, my school offered amazing extracurricular activities that taught me valuable lessons for life.

item.title: Bachelor in Finance and Economics
item.description: Details Institution: University of Arkansas at Little Rock, USA Duration: August 2017 - May 2020 GPA: 3.88 Institutional Honors: Magna Cum Laude Academic Awards Pages Institution: Cardinal Stritch University, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA Duration: August 2016 - May 2017 (Freshman year) GPA: 3.92 Relevant Courses My degrees' most relevant and interesting courses that helped me shape my understanding of Financial and Economic principles and develop business acumen. Finance Financial Modeling

item.title: Bachelor in Business Analytics
item.description: Details Institution: University of Arkansas at Little Rock, USA Duration: August 2020 - May 2021 Academic Awards Pages Relevant Courses The following courses are the most interesting and relevant courses in my one-year postbaccalaureate program. Analytics Predictive Analytics Using statistical methods (Multiple Regression, ANOVA, Logistic Regression, Quantile Regression, ARIMA) and statistical tools (R and Python) to predict financial and economic outcomes. Marketing Research Using Python and R to predict and test marketing outcomes (A/B testing, Multiple Regression, Clustering, T-Testing).

item.title: Work Experience
item.description: University of Arkansas at Little Rock Research Assistant Department of Finance and Economics December 2020 - current Assisting Economics and Finance Department in research projects. Job function includes reading and analyzing of academic articles and papers, data collection, cleaning, and analysis. Other responsibilities entail proofreading, editing, and contributing to academic research. Currently working on a public health journal article to investigate the seasonality of depression under the influence of COVID-19.
